titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences museum plan reproductions 1977.181
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-24T13:23-0400

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences museum plan reproductions
did.abstract: Collection contains eight photographic reproductions of architectural drawings and plans for the proposed Brooklyn Museum of Arts and Sciences. The plans were created by the firm McKim, Mead & White for the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, circa 1893. Also included are clippings from the Brooklyn Daily Eagle which relate to the construction of the museum, dating from February 26, 1896.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences records, 1843-1979 (ARC.011)
Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences publications and ephemera, 1877-1998 (ARC.138)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences museum plan reproductions, 1977.181, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Accessioned in 1977.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Collection is in the public domain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection contains eight photographic reproductions of architectural drawings and plans for the proposed Brooklyn Museum of Arts and Sciences. The plans were created by the firm McKim, Mead & White for the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences, circa 1893. Also included are clippings from the Brooklyn Daily Eagle which relate to the construction of the museum, dating from February 26, 1896.
